availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, private (U.S.A.). Germany native. Married to Louisa Kremer. Father of Rudolph Kremer and Jane Kremer. Shoemaker in Louisville, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 28th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry as Private from October 10, 1861 to March 11, 1863. Discharged due to illness and disability on March 11, 1863 in Cincinnati, Ohio. Applied for pension as an invalid on March 13, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 262-3.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson, Louisville Ward 3, p. 672.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 394.
Organization Index of Pension Files of Veterans Who Served Between 1861 and 1900, NARA RG15. Publication no. T289, roll 282.
